title: Horton hears a who!; Thidwick the big-hearted moose
creator_contributor_role: Victorian Council for Children's Films and Television, distributor
subject_group: Literature/Children's literature - Film and video adaptations
description: Episode of Series "Dr. Seuss video classics". Don't give up! I believe in you all! A person's a person, no matter how small! The tiny who's are in big trouble! If stout hearted Horton the elephant can't prove that his miniature friends exist, they will be boiled in Beeze-Nut oil! A charming tale of friendship and perserverance narrated by Dustin Hoffman. Thidwick, the moose is the host who "has to put up with all kind of pests, For a host, above all, must be nice to his guests!" but the increasing burden of 500lbs of uninvited guests nestling in his antlers is solved only when he sheds them! Narrated by Merwyn Goldsmith, Ron Marshall and Larry Robinson.
related_objects: Series; S01236; Dr. Seuss video classics; Active; 1992
